title: Bug 11306 - New Class Wizard Launches Simple Project Wizard
description: This bug report concerns the behavior of the New Class Wizard launching the wrong wizard when no existing projects are present.
OB: When attempting to create a new class in the Java perspective of a new workspace, the New Class Wizard prompts the user to create a new project, which is handy. However, upon selecting 'yes' to create a new project, the resulting dialog is the first page of the generic New Project Wizard, rather than the expected Java Project wizard.
EB: The expected behavior is that when creating a new class with no existing projects, the New Class Wizard should open the Java Project wizard directly, as it is the appropriate wizard for this context.
SR:
To reproduce this issue:
1. Launch the software in a new workspace.
2. Open the Java perspective.
3. Click the 'New Class' button or option.
4. Observe that the New Class Wizard appears and prompts you to create a new project. Answer 'yes' to create a new project.
5. Note that instead of the Java Project wizard, the first page of the generic New Project Wizard is displayed.
